title: Ticket #1930: Add support for advertising .NET on Windows
description:
With the increasing use of the .NET framework for Windows application development, providing an out of the box solution for detecting which version of .NET is present on a machine becomes more useful. There are however a couple of caveats on how .NET versions are detected.

The latest .NET runtime has no problems executing the bytecode of earlier versions. However, the runtime library that includes all of the classes and functionality are different from version to version. To be absolute certain that a .NET 3.5 application will run, the .NET 3.5 libraries must be installed even if .NET 4.0 has been installed. Further complicating this is how .NET 4.0 has been split into a "Client" and "Full" install. Thus merely advertising just the latest version of .NET installed on a Windows sytem is insufficient. Every version of .NET installed must be advertised.

This page lists the differences between Client and Full: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc656912.aspx

The current design for advertising .NET involves using a single classad attribute, DotNetVersions, that holds a comma delimited list of .NET versions as follows:

  • 1.1: .Net 1.1
  • 2.0: .Net 2.0
  • 3.0: .Net 3.0
  • 3.5: .Net 3.5
  • 4.0Client: .Net 4.0 Client Profile
  • 4.0Full: .Net 4.0 Full

Thus an end user who requires a specific version of .NET can add this expression to their submit file: 

  requirement = stringListMember("3.5", "DotNetVersions")
